channel.title: Mithril Seeds Problem!
channel.description:
So basically I can plant mithril seeds ok but just other players can't see it!
http://prntscr.com/3fniyu
Any ideas?

item.title: Mithril Seeds Problem!
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

his object manager is probably fine? it’s just the method that he’s calling. also, if players are in the region whilst it’s spawned as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Mithril Seeds Problem!
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:4, topic:542756”][quote author=matzie link=topic=661631.msg4422388#msg4422388 date=1399087669]
It is needed as a GlobalObject.
You probably don’t have a Suitable object manager in your server.
To make it work correctly, you would have to parse Objects by region, see what objects are “new” (needed to be added by given client) and send an update to that client. It is complicated to theorize how every little detail will work.
Farming - is not a global object manager.
[/quote]

why are you over-complicating things?

your creating a local object, so replace your create object method with c.getPA().object(flowerIdentification, playerX, playerY, faceType, objectHeight);

then remove it. notice how the parameters are playerX and playerY (which is the objectX and objectY), because you want to spawn the object where the player is standing.[/quote]
What you said means… HE HAS A SUITABLE OBJECT MANAGER. In reality, if you walk into the region after it is spawned. new players should see it too.

Read full topic

item.title: Mithril Seeds Problem!
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:3, topic:542756”]It is needed as a GlobalObject.
You probably don’t have a Suitable object manager in your server.
To make it work correctly, you would have to parse Objects by region, see what objects are “new” (needed to be added by given client) and send an update to that client. It is complicated to theorize how every little detail will work.
Farming - is not a global object manager.[/quote]

why are you over-complicating things?

your creating a local object, so replace your create object method with c.getPA().object(flowerIdentification, playerX, playerY, faceType, objectHeight);

then remove it. notice how the parameters are playerX and playerY (which is the objectX and objectY), because you want to spawn the object where the player is standing.

item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

It is needed as a GlobalObject.
You probably don’t have a Suitable object manager in your server.
To make it work correctly, you would have to parse Objects by region, see what objects are “new” (needed to be added by given client) and send an update to that client. It is complicated to theorize how every little detail will work.
Farming - is not a global object manager.

item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Just loop through all the players in the area and spawn the flower.
